intro: Disarrenum antarcticum, commonly known as the Antarctic pearlwort, is a flowering plant native to the cold regions of the Southern Hemisphere. It is a low-growing perennial species that thrives in rocky and coastal environments. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically succulent to retain moisture in harsh conditions. It is well adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and strong winds. Disarrenum antarcticum plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its native range.
